Posts.Content: hyphencollins wrote: Hi everyone,  I'm not at all sure in which forum to post this question; my question is biopsy-related although not about waiting for testing results!  In my "good" breast, I just noticed a huge dimple as I lift my arm.  I was recently (3 weeks ago? I can hardly remember at this point) biopsied there and was diagnosed with PASH, a benign condition.  The PASH was non-palpable and only discovered through MRI.  I'm pretty sure this dimple is really new - like not-here-a-couple-of-days ago-new.  Anyone get dimpling after biopsy (in this case, an MRI-assisted biopsy)? If so, did it resolve?  I'm leaning toward a  prophylactic mastectomy on that side anyway but I'm not 100% there yet (will meet with Plastic Surgeon this week).  Thanks in advance! Multifocal IDC with EIC. Oncotype 23. Dx 5/2014, DCIS, Grade 3 Dx 5/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 7/30/2014 Lymph node removal: Left; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Chemotherapy 10/1/2014 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 1/25/2015 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 3/9/2015 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ? re: dimpling - resulting from biopsy? hyphencollins Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: hyphencollins wrote: Hi everyone, I'm recently diagnosed and have had a consult with the surgeon but she's waiting for my MRI results before determining UMX or lumpectomy.  (I have two areas of concern confirmed with a possible third so she thinks breast conserving surgery may not leave much worth conserving).  I'm trying to get some understanding of recovery period of UMX with SNB... I work FT and don't know what to expect about out of work time... and am somewhat stressed about it.  I didn't get a clear answer from the surgeon ("quicker than you might think") and I can't seem to find the info on the surgery articles.  I realize recovery times vary but what might someone typically expect?  Thanks! Multifocal IDC with EIC. Oncotype 23.
